com.example.entities

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.entities.Entity
      • com.example.entities.Moving
        • com.example.entities.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interactive, Loopable

    public final class Player
extends Moving
implements Interactive
    The player-controlled space ship that utilizes a singleton pattern allowing the class to be accessed anywhere.

    • Method Detail

      • I

        public static Player I()
        Returns the instance of this class to be accessed globally. Because of this, an instance of this class may theoretically be anywhere in this project.
        Returns:
        INSTANCE

      • processInput

        public void processInput()
        Processes the user input accordingly based on the WASD keys and mouse location. Acceleration is adjusted from the movement keys while the rotation is determined with the mouse location.
        Specified by:
        processInput in interface Interactive

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the various movement vectors including the resistance/friction of Player Player and the renders and the rotation.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Loopable
        Overrides:
        update in class Moving

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                   float interpolation)
        Renders the various Player renders.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Loopable
        Overrides:
        render in class Moving

      • setTargetSpd

        public void setTargetSpd(float targetSpd)
        Sets the target speed.
        Parameters:
        targetSpd - The target or capped speed.

      • getTargetSpd

        public float getTargetSpd()
